text: Nice work! Did you light the piece too?
Would be wonderful to see it in a studio lighting set up- take a look at downloading this one and trying it out: <http://www.jahirulamin.com/environments/studio-prop-lookdev-lighting-rig>

attachments.title: Prop Look Development and Lighting Rig  — Jahirul Amin
attachments.text: This is a digital prop studio light rig suitable for look devving and lighting small to medium sized assets. It comes 3 modelled softbox lights, a table and a drape. Simply pop your asset into the scene, add your shaders, tweak the lights (or add additional lights) and hit render. The environment
attachments.fallback: Jahirul Amin: Prop Look Development and Lighting Rig  — Jahirul Amin

text: Maybe you could try reducing the bump or displacement value/scale slightly and bringing back slightly the specular- on the right it's catching the light quite nicely. It would really highlight the work you've done on the displacement :slightly_smiling_face:

```ahh thank you! I did do the lighting, but it was something I wanted to come back to in the future haha. I'll look into that set up and try it out, thank you for sending me that :') Thank you for the pointers also, I'll get onto that! I'm still new to look dev so I'm learning a lot atm haha! c:```
